es.ull.isaatc.util
Class SingleThreadPool<T extends java.lang.Runnable>

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      es.ull.isaatc.util.SingleThreadPool<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ThreadPool<T>, java.lang.Runnable
public class SingleThreadPool<T extends java.lang.Runnable>
extends java.lang.Thread
implements ThreadPool<T>

A single threaded pool of threads. This structure is intended to execute a set of tasks in a sequential order. This pool has a queue of waiting tasks and a semaphore to control the idle time.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

Method Detail

run

public void run()
Execution loop. The thread is initially put into the idle state. Once a task arrives, the thread is awaken and executes it. As the task is finished, the thread becomes idle again. The loop repeats until the finished flag is set to true.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

execute

public void execute(T ev)
Puts a task in the pending task queue. This action releases the semaphore in the main loop.

Specified by:
execute in interface ThreadPool<T extends java.lang.Runnable>

ev - Task to be executed
